titleInfo.title: Papers concerning a Letter from King Louis Phillippe of France to Maharajah Ranjit Singh

physicalDescription.extent: There is an abstract of contents of the despatch, numbered 1-4, on folio 302. These numbers are repeated for reference on the last verso of each enclosure.

mods.abstract: Enclosures to Despatch to the Secret Committee No. 17, dated 20 October 1837.The enclosures relate to a letter from King Louis Phillippe of France to Maharajah Runjeet Singh [Ranjit Singh, Ruler of the Punjab], promoting good relations between France and the Punjab. The enclosures are dated 15 September and 9 October 1837.The papers consist of: letter from Captain Claude Martine Wade, Political Agent, Loodiana [Ludhiana], describing the letter, which had been presented to the Maharajah by the French King's Agent, General Jean-Fran√ßois Allard, and making comments on the letter and Allard's involvement; a copy of the letter in French (dated 24 October 1835); and a letter of acknowledgement from the Secretary to the Government of India (William Hay Macnaghten).
